item.title: Route
item.description: .marker { display: block; border: none; border-radius: 50%; cursor: pointer; padding: 0; } .mapboxgl-popup { max-width: 400px; font: 16px 'Lora', serif; } .

item.title: Crew
item.description: We’re a family of five traveling around the world in a Catana 401 named Vite & Rêves. You can translate this name as Fast & Dreams, but it’s also pronounced the same way as ‘Vis tes rêves’ — Live your dreams.

item.title: Vite & Rêves
item.description: Sailing the Catana 401 shows her to be very fast with frank accelerations. She is easy to handle, both under sail and with motors. The gentle steering and comfort make it possible to be at the helm for long hours without fatigue.

item.title: Resume Life
item.description: Grenada beaches are open again! Finally!

item.title: Another Beach Walk
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew goes to ‘exercise’ again on the beach.

item.title: Gas Gas Gas Gas
item.description: Vite & Rêves is out of gas. We need a new regulator. Again.

item.title: Escape to the Beach
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew can’t take it anymore and defies curfew for a brief walk on the beach.

item.title: Helder's Birthday
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew celebrate Helder’s birthday.

item.title: What We Do When There Is Nothing to Do
item.description: A glimpse into Vite & Rêves lockdown life.

item.title: Green Flash
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew sees a green flash at sunset.

item.title: What Day Is This?
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew is starting to suffer from quarantine fatigue.

item.title: Stuck
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew make the best of the lockdown in Grenada.

item.title: Easter
item.description: The Easter bunny did find the Vite & Rêves crew after all.

item.title: Going South
item.description: Vite & Rêves sails south again on the windward side of the island.

item.title: Ronde Island
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew find a quiet beach at uninhabited Ronde Island.

item.title: Sauteurs
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew run almost out of drinking water in Sauteurs.

item.title: Duquesne Bay
item.description: In search of a deserted beach, Vite & Rêves ends up in Duquesne Bay. It was not deserted after all.

item.title: Gouyave
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew spend a few relaxing days at Gouyave.

item.title: Living statues
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew try to escape the St. George lockdown and sail to Gouyave.

item.title: Virus vexation
item.description: In which a coronavirus makes it very difficult for the Parents to get back home.

item.title: Grand Anse Bay
item.description: Vite & Rêves moves out of the marina to Grand Anse Bay.

item.title: Saint George
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew sail with the Parents around the southern part of the island to Saint George.

item.title: Immigration Blues
item.description: Immigration in Grenada proves to be a bit of an ordeal.

item.title: Night Sail to Grenada
item.description: An easy night sail brings Vite & Rêves from Tobago to Grenada

item.title: Farewell Dream Crew
item.description: We’re saying a fond farewell to our dream crew Hannah and Antoine.

item.title: Buccoo Reef
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew visit the now very dead Buccoo Reef, to their great disappointment.

item.title: Buccoo
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew sail south to meet up with hospitalized Hannah and Antoine in Buccoo.

item.title: Scarborough
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew try to find a sim card and the carnival in Scarburough.

item.title: Charlotteville
item.description: Vite & Rêves clears in into Tobago and the crew explore the offbeat village of Charlotteville.

item.title: Across the Atlantic Ocean
item.description: Vite & Rêves crosses the Atlantic Ocean in 14 days. It was… interesting.

item.title: Tarrafal De Monte Trigo
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew want to see a bit of Sant’Antão as well and sail to Tarrafal.

item.title: São Pedro Bay
item.description: Vite & Rêves anchors in a beautiful bay. The crew are astonished by the local wildlife.

item.title: Mindelo
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew explore Mindelo on São Vicente.

item.title: Cabo Verde Crossing
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew cross from the Canary Islands to Cabo Verde.

item.title: Barbara's Birthday
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew celebrate Barbara’s birthday with a veritable sailing village of Dutch sailors.

item.title: Get Ready
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew is getting the boat ready for the big crossing of the Atlantic Ocean.

item.title: Finding Crew
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew want to find more crew members to help with the crossing.

item.title: Las Palmas
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew encounter the slowest marina officials to date in Las Palmas.

item.title: To Gran Canaria
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew do a night sail from Lanzarote to Gran Canaria.

item.title: At Anchor Again
item.description: After a month on the ocean and in marinas, the Vite & Rêves crew finally can anchor in a bay again.

item.title: Lanzarote
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew are getting reorganized in Rubicon Marina and take a long walk along the south coast of Lanzarote.

item.title: Island Rush
item.description: Vite & Rêves probably broke her average speed record between La Graciosa and the south of Lanzarote.

item.title: Canary Crossing
item.description: Vite & Rêves makes a pleasant crossing from Morocco to the Canary Islands in the start of the trade winds.

item.title: Essaouira
item.description: The town of Essaouira leaves the Vite & Rêves crew with mixed feelings.

item.title: Flat Ocean
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew spend two days motoring to Essaouira on a glassy ocean.

item.title: Rabat
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew spend too little time in Rabat, or actually in its sister city, Salé.

item.title: Sailing Again
item.description: Vite & Rêves sails south from Tangier to Rabat.

item.title: Tangier Part 2
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew are stuck in Tangier because of the wind but they’re enjoying the vacation.

item.title: Tangier
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew are taking a rest in Tangier.

item.title: Bye Europe, Hello Africa
item.description: Vite & Rêves crosses the strait of Gibraltar and arrives in one piece in Tangier.

item.title: The Push
item.description: Part 2 of Vite & Rêves’ final push out of the Mediterranean Sea.

item.title: Sinterklaas Evening
item.description: We spend a few lost days in Almeria

item.title: Broad Reach
item.description: Vite & Rêves sails the whole day on a broad reach before a storm.

item.title: Meeting People
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew meet new people on Cartagena marina’s weekly barbecue.

item.title: Cartagena
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew visit Cartagena while they’re waiting for a good wind.

item.title: De Properste Week
item.description: Geen gezeul met vuil wasgoed door de stad, een heerlijk warme douche wanneer we dat wilden en een toilet doorspoelen met een simpele druk op de knop. Kijk, dat maakte mij ontzettend goedgemutst.

item.title: Fishy Business
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew evade a fish farm on the short trip from Gorguel Bay to Cartagena, straight into the wind.

item.title: Regaining Our Sea Legs
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew leave Alicante for Cartagena on a windy but quiet sea.

item.title: Waiting in Alicante
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew get stuck by a storm in Alicante and explore the town some more.

item.title: Birthday
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew celebrates Pieter Jan’s birthday in Alicante. His brother made a surprise appearance.

item.title: Meet the Parents
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew have a super nice sailing day to Alicante, where they meet up with the Parents.

item.title: Calpe
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew spend a day in forgettable Calpe.

item.title: Reaching the Mainland
item.description: A strong breeze on the beam hurtles Vite & Rêves from Ibiza to Calpe.

item.title: Santa Eulària Des Riu
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew visit the lovely town of Santa Eulària Des Riu and spend the night on the other side of the island.

item.title: Party Flight
item.description: Vite & Rêves flies at top speed towards Ibiza, the party island.

item.title: Hide and Seek
item.description: Vite & Rêves plays hide and seek with the storm systems of the western Mediterranean.

item.title: A Simple Plan
item.description: During the crossing from Menorca to Mallorca, the genua sheet breaks.

item.title: Crossing to Menorca
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew cross from Sardinia to Menorca. It was wild but went okay.

item.title: Waiting for a Window
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew wait a couple of days for a good weather window to make the crossing to Menorca.

item.title: Hunkering Down
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew are hunkering down for the storm. Maurice, the captain of Ikigai, proves to be a veritable goldmine of Pacific Ocean knowledge.

item.title: Finding Shelter
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew go a little more westward to hunker down for the coming storm.

item.title: Flying south
item.description: Vite & Rêves flies a bit further south and gives Véronique a small taste of open sea sailing.

item.title: Nora / Out of Gas
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew visit the most important archeological site in Sardinia and go on a quest for cooking gas.

item.title: Bay Sail
item.description: We made a short sail in the bay of Cagliari to Pula/Nora

item.title: Cagliari Part 2
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew spent a few hours provisioning and the rest of the day discovering Cagliari’s old town.

item.title: Cagliari
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew meet up with Véronique in the industrial port of Cagliari

item.title: Motorcrossing
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew cross the Tyrrhenian sea to Sardinia, sadly largely on engine.

item.title: Anchor Bender
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew fix a bent anchor and provision between thunderstorms.

item.title: Weather Turning
item.description: Following winds clash at the end of the day with another weather system, bringing a huge thunderstorm.

item.title: Nightly Joyride
item.description: A very calm day ends with an exhilarating joyride past Palermo.

item.title: Chasing Zephyrs
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew spent a day chasing very light winds, without much success.

item.title: Calm Milazzo
item.description: Milazzo castle was closed, so the Vite & Rêves crew found a big supermarket and motor a bit in the right direction.

item.title: Scylla and Charybdis
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew dodge traffic in the Strait of Messina and safely pass Scilla and Charybdis.

item.title: Easy Strait
item.description: A slow spinnaker sail through Messina Strait.

item.title: The Perfect Sail
item.description: A late leave turns into the perfect sailing day. So perfect Pieter Jan couldn’t stop sailing and pulled and all-nighter.

item.title: Nice Swim / Upwind Rollercoaster
item.description: A pleasant morning spent swimming followed by a rollercoaster afternoon with 40 knots close hauled sailing.

item.title: The Longest Day
item.description: A long crossing turned into an upwind slog at night. The Vite & Rêves crew dodged gas platforms before arriving in Crotone.

item.title: Siesta, Signore
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew are trying to get things done. Siesta got in the way.

item.title: Laundry Day
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew found a laundromat and made the most of it thanks to laundromat regular Pascuale.

item.title: Across The Adriatic
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew cross the Adriatic Sea to Italy on a fast clip.

item.title: Resting Day
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew took a day of rest and provisioning in Palaiokastrita before our crossing to Italy.

item.title: Front Surfing
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew anchored too close to another boat and had to leave for Corfu. The day was sharply divided in a nice spinnaker sail and an exhilarating surf down thunderstorm waves.

item.title: Making Water
item.description: A windless day saw the Vite & Rêves crew motoring all the way to Antipaxoi island where they had to try a few bays before finding one that would hold the boat safely.

item.title: In Odysseus' Footsteps
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew discovered the palace of Odysseus on the island of Ithaki after a very early forced start in the morning.

item.title: Thunderstuck
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew got stuck in Agios Nikolaos. There were thunderstorms all around us all day long. It rained. The berth became untenable due te the heavy swell.

item.title: Shipwreck Beach
item.description: No visit to Zakynthos would be complete without a stop at Shipwreck Beach. Getting away from there proved… challenging.

item.title: A Fast Run
item.description: A close-hauled sail took the Vite & Rêves crew to Zakythos.

item.title: Deserted Katakolo
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew are stuck for a day in the eery town of Katakolo. They did meet a nice local who sold them vegetables straight from his garden.

item.title: A Bit Of Everything
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew encountered several waterspouts on the way to Zakynthos. Due to a 360 degree wind shift, they ended up in Katakolo.

item.title: On Achieving Calm
item.description: After a tricky start, the Vite & Rêves crew ended up in the delightful, quiet bay of Panagoula.

item.title: Tight Sailing
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew ended up in Pylos but there was no room for them in the marina.

item.title: Koroni Castle
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew visited the huge castle of Koroni.

item.title: No Time To Waste
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew saw a dolphin on the way to Koroni.

item.title: Wing And Wing
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew set sail for the very relaxed village of Geralimena.

item.title: Rounding Cape Maleas
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew rounded cape Maleas and dropped anchor at Elafonisos beach.

item.title: Alle begin is moeilijk
item.description: Het is al ruim een week geleden dat we startten aan dit zotte avontuur. De halve wereld rond, met ons vijven, op onze catamaran ‘Vite & Rêves’.

item.title: Uncooperative Winds
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew set sail for the island of Kythira but ended up in the tiny industrial port of Velanidia.

item.title: Medieval Monemvasia
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew visited the very beautiful medieval city of Monemvasia.

item.title: Gale Sailing
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew set sail for Monemvasia and arrived in a Gale, just before a thunderstorm broke loose.

item.title: Relaxing At Vlychada Bay
item.description: Vlychada bay was so nice that the Vite & Rêves crew decided to stay for a day.

item.title: No Wind
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew set sail for Monemvasia but didn’t make it because the wind died completely. They discovered a paradisiacal bay though!

item.title: Kissed The Quay
item.description: The wind picked up so much that our anchor didn’t hold. The Vite & Rêves crew reanchored and visited Vlychos beach.

item.title: A Fond Farewell
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew moved the boat to the lovely Hydra port and said goodbye to the Parents.

item.title: Lazy Line Troubles
item.description: A rocky start turned into a great sailing day.

item.title: Shopping And Provisioning
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew moved the boat to Lavrion port and went Ikea shopping.

item.title: Started In Lavrion
item.description: The Vite & Rêves crew are getting ready to leave for our world trip. They took 5 small suitcases and 2 big ones of clothes and stuff, 3 kids and 2 Parents with us. The Parents will travel back at the end of the week.

item.title: We Have A Boat!
item.description: We bought a boat and did a shake-down cruise in August. It was glorious!
